Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy vs. Chemoradiotherapy in Locally Advanced Rectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: 663 patients with LARC within 12 cm from the anal verge and uninvolved MRF were randomised

Participants.evidence: 663 patients with LARC within 12 cm from the anal verge and uninvolved MRF

Intervention.evidence: randomised to nCT (4 cycles of CAPOX) or nCRT (capecitabine with 50 Gy radiation)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates neoadjuvant chemotherapy (nCT) as an alternative in lower-risk locally advanced rectal cancer (LARC)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was 3-year local-regional failure-free survival

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by tumor location and nodal staging, with allocation concealment via central randomisation

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between June 2014 and October 2020, 589 patients received treatment (nCT: 300, nCRT: 289)

Result_Outcome.evidence: pCR rates were 11.0% (95% CI, 7.8-15.3%) for nCT and 13.8% (95% CI, 10.1-18.5%) for nCRT (p=0.33)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, with grade 3-4 toxicities in 12.3% of nCT and 8.3% of nCRT patients (p=0.11)
